snippet: South Korea moved to prop up its economy on Thursday with an unexpected interest rate cut, and the odds of a similar move in Australia rose after weak job data.
abstract: Gloom battering the United States and European economies is increasingly dragging down Asia; Asian Development Bank lowers its 2012 forecast for economic growth in developing Asian countries to 6.6 percent from 6.9 percent, and projects revised 2013 growth of 7.1 percent, from 7.3 percent.
lead_paragraph: South Korea moved to prop up its economy on Thursday with an unexpected interest rate cut, and the odds of a similar move in Australia rose after weak job data.

headline.main: Weak Economies in the United States and Europe Weigh Down Asia
headline.print_headline: Weak Economies in the United States and Europe Weigh Down Asia

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
